title: Microsoft Requirement: Video playback must not be interrupted more than twice within a 10 minute period on a console with a constant downstream bandwidth of at least 1.8 Mbps
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the Channel is installed
AND a network profile with the follow information has been applied to the console using NEWT: 

1.8MB Per Second: 1.8 megabit/sec downstream
Downstream setting: BW & Queue
Bandwidth = 1.8 Mbps 
Queue:
Drop Type = Drop Tail
Mode = Packet Mode

AND the user is signed into Xbox Live
custom_steps:
WHEN the Channel is accessed
AND a video of at least ten minutes in length is being played
AND a stopwatch is used to count the number of video playback interruptions.
custom_expected: THEN there will be no more than two interruptions of greater than one second in that 10 minute period.

title: Microsoft Requirement: All common MediaPlayer controls work as intended during full screen playback
custom_preconds: GIVEN the Channel has been installed
custom_steps:
WHEN the Channel has been accessed
AND full screen playback is enabled
AND it is verified that the common MediaPlayer is supported
AND every control is exercised
custom_expected:
THEN all controls that are supported work as intended
AND if there are any controls that do not work as intended are not mapped to do anything else



-----------------------------
Known open issue(s) that cause this issue to Fail: (note to be removed from test case when verified fixed)
1. On Now Linear/Live video stream; scan fwd from Live and then Play; video resumes from a point in the previous hour of content https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/WWECD-2659
2. Live Linear > Rewinding or Fast Forwarding during a live linear broadcast jumps the user back the user a hour https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/WWECD-3053

title: Microsoft Requirement: All content within media titles must be rated using established ratings systems that are appropriate for all applicable regions
custom_preconds: GIVEN that the channel has been installed
custom_steps:
WHEN the channel is accessed
AND content within the app that needs to be rated has been identified
custom_expected: THEN for each piece of content that needs to be rated, and appropriate rating is displayed.

title: Microsoft Requirement: Users without sufficient ratings privileges should not be able to access content without confirmation via pin code
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the channel is installed
AND content has been rated appropriately
AND a profile has been created with with appropriate level set one level lower than rated content
custom_steps:
WHEN the channel is accessed
AND the user attempts to access the content rated higher than their profile allows
custom_expected:
THEN the user will not be able to access the content.


Note: in certain cases, the user may access by first entering their account PIN code to bypass the restriction.

title: Deep-Link support  XR-105 (WWE/MLB/HBO specific links)
custom_preconds:
All titles must be able to receive a deep link from the system. If a request is not supported or is malformed, a title must fail gracefully.
Media apps must support deep links into content and must handle the deep-link schema as defined in the Deep Linking in Xbox One section in the Xbox One Application Development Kit documentation.
custom_steps:
1a. Sign into an Xbox Live profile.
1b. Do not Sign in to Xbox Live profile

2. Using PC with Xbox XDK tools installed; Launch the Xbox One ADK command prompt window
3. connect to the XB1 device by typing: xbconnect <enter the xb1 tools IP address>.
4. Once the operations has completed sucessfully, Launch the title using each of the following Deeplinks: 
5. type each xbapp launch command (below) in the command prompt and enter to see if the deep-link works.

ADK command line.


HBO Now specific: There are 6 standard ways to deep link to the app and all are supported.

xbapp launch "ms-xbl-1D5E9C66://media-playback?contentId=PROD761557&contentType=movie"

Navigate to “Game of Thrones” Series Details
xbapp launch "ms-xbl-1D5E9C66://media-details?contentId=game_of_thrones&contentType=tvseries"

Navigate to “Game of Thrones” series, season 1, episode 3 "Lord Snow" Details
xbapp launch "ms-xbl-1D5E9C66://media-details?contentId=PROD726739&contentType=tvepisode"

Navigate to “Mad Max: Fury Road” Details
xbapp launch "ms-xbl-1D5E9C66://media-details?contentId=PROD718509&contentType=movie"

Navigate to “Paper Towns” Details
xbapp launch "ms-xbl-1D5E9C66://media-details?contentId=PROD779379&contentType=movie"

Navigate to “Far from the Maddening Crowd” Details
xbapp launch "ms-xbl-1D5E9C66://media-details?contentId=PROD767037&contentType=movie"


WWE specific: There are 6 standard ways to deep link to the app and all are supported.
xbapp launch "ms-xbl-7546DAD1://”
xbapp launch "ms-xbl-7546DAD1://default?contentId=&contentType="
xbapp launch "ms-xbl-7546DAD1://media-playback?contentId=31291111&contentType=tvSeries"
xbapp launch "ms-xbl-7546DAD1://media-details?contentId=31291111&contentType=tvSeries"
xbapp launch "ms-xbl-7546DAD1://media-search?contentId=&contentType="
xbapp launch "ms-xbl-7546DAD1://media-help?contentId=&contentType="
xbapp launch "ms-xbl-7546DAD1://media-settings?contentId=&contentType="
*xbapp launch ms-xbl-7546DAD1://xbapp

MLB.TV specific: 
note- Settings and Help deeplinks are not supported, so app should take user to home page
xbapp launch "ms-xbl-5CCF99D4://"
xbapp launch "ms-xbl-5CCF99D4://default?contentId=&contentType="
xbapp launch "ms-xbl-5CCF99D4://media-playback?contentId=2015/03/10/detmlb-phimlb-1&contentType=tvShow"
xbapp launch "ms-xbl-5CCF99D4://media-details?contentId=2015/03/10/detmlb-phimlb-1&contentType=tvShow"
xbapp launch "ms-xbl-5CCF99D4://media-help?contentId=&contentType="
xbapp launch "ms-xbl-5CCF99D4://media-settings?contentId=&contentType="
*xbapp launch "ms-xbl-5CCF99D4://media-details?contentId=xyz&contentType=tvShow"
custom_expected:
The title proceeds to the main menu without displaying an error message.

The empty deep-link goes to Home
The default and settings both go to the home page (if logged in)
The help goes to the home page and launches help
The search goes to the search page (if available in app)
The details goes to the show launch page. The link has a valid contentId in it
The playback goes directly to the video

*(The malformed deep-link goes to an error screen, with friendly message; which then jumps to home when backed out of.)

title: (THIS SEEMS TO BE GONE FROM JULY_2016 XRs; no longer required?)  XR-091 - Content Ratings - The title must not allow the user to stream restricted content by dismissing the parental challenge.
custom_preconds:
All content within media titles must be rated using the established ratings systems (such as TVPG or MPAA) that are appropriate for all applicable regions. Any content that does not have ratings data associated with it is considered to be Unrated.
Unrated content that has been curated by the publisher may use the appropriate Xbox Store Age Rating for the content. Unrated content that has been given an Xbox Store Age Rating must decorate the content within the app identifying the Xbox Store Age Rating associated with the content.
custom_steps:
1. Sign into an Xbox profile that is linked to a publisher account and ensure the profile’s age restriction is set to Appropriate up to age 8.
2. Launch the title and proceed to the main menu.
3. Select any available content which is over the user’s age restriction.
4. Attempt to progress into active video playback.
5. Observe that the parental challenge is displayed, press the B button twice.
custom_expected:
User is returned to Show Launch. 
The title must not allow the user to view content that is rated higher than the restriction set.

title: XR-013: Linking Microsoft Accounts w/ Publisher Accounts; terms of use & policies must be made available for review
custom_preconds:
If Microsoft Account and publisher accounts are to be linked for use of application, then the terms of use and policies must be made available for review in app
OR
user must be informed how to review the terms of use and policies at time of linking and for the duration of the accounts' linked status.
custom_expected:
Users have the ability to view the applicable terms of use and policies within the app, or informs users how to review them, both during the linking process and for as long as the accounts are linked.

Terms of Use and/or Privacy Policy URLs will be added to Sign in Screen and Help> Account Management.

title: XR-113: Active User Management:title must indicate the active user(s) before the first profile-related action is taken on that user’s profile.
custom_preconds:
If a title uses user profiles, the title must indicate the active user(s) before the first profile-related action is taken on that user’s profile. 
Titles must provide an entry point to the account picker to change the active user.
custom_steps:
Examples:
The gamerpic or XB Live user account info must display at:
*+ sign in/sign out
+ profile settings
custom_expected:
The title must update the context of the title following a user change via the account picker.


*Note: WWE has been approved with gamepic only displaying on the MY ACCOUNT page

title: XR-03-02: Confirm The title transitions out of the Sign In screen when the user signs out of and back into an Xbox profile via the Xbox Home account picker.
custom_steps:
1. Sign into an Xbox profile linked to a publisher account.
2. Ensure that the console is set as the user’s Home console and launch the title.
3. From the main menu, select any media asset proceed into media playback 
4. Press the Xbox button to constrain the title.
5. Access the Xbox Home account picker and sign out of the Xbox profile mentioned in step [1].
6. Sign back into the Xbox profile mentioned in step [1] and resume the title.
7. From the Sign In screen, select Sign In > the Xbox profile in use.
custom_expected: The title must allow the user to resume use of the title following a sign-in change.

title: Confirm Version # is correct for submission/resubmission (request app manifest from Dev/technical PM)
custom_preconds:
The version minor number needs an update for each CU:

1.4.0.0
1.5.0.0
1.6.0.0

The nano number needs an update for each CU resubmission

1.5.0.0
1.5.0.1
1.5.0.2

QA is provided submission builds for testing, and those builds are always named with the version as the prefix of the filename of the binary that’s installed on the Xbox One for testing. Checking that is suitable for this test case.
custom_steps:
Confirm the current app being tested for submission is incremented by 1 up from the current version released in retail.

example: 
Retail app version is 1.4.0.0
Submission app version is 1.5.0.0


IF the app Fails the submission certification process, then 
Re-Submission app version is 1.5.0.1



OR:
Request App manifest from Dev:  (app version # and all other conceivable info included in manifest)

(steps to be completed later how to locate Version # in manifest)

title: XR-001 Title Stability
XR-003 Title Quality for Submission 003-1
XR-003 Title Quality for Submission 003-2
XR-003 Title Quality for Submission 003-3
XR-003 Title Quality for Submission 003-4 Language Support
custom_steps:
"1. Sign in to an Xbox profile.
2. Launch the title.
3. Navigate to the console’s language settings and set the language to match that of the console locale being used.
4. Taking each in turn, ensure that the title boots correctly and exhibits the correct localization for each supported language in the title.
5. Ensure that all game-critical text that is essential for progression within the title is legible."
custom_expected: Titles must boot correctly in all language settings, and they must exhibit the correct localization for all supported languages in-game. In areas where text for supported languages is displayed, the text must remain legible regardless of the display setup.

title: XR-003 Title Quality for Submission 003-5 Navigation
custom_steps:
"1. Sign in to an Xbox profile.
2. Launch the title.
3. Navigate through all menu and option screens (front-end, in-game, and other areas) with the controller, ensuring that all the navigation buttons function as expected.
a. If button labels or command prompts are displayed within any menu UI, verify that each command can be issued correctly.
4. Repeat Step [3] with natural user interface (NUI), if supported and the sensor is connected and enabled.
5. Repeat Step [3] with voice user interface (VUI), if supported and the sensor is connected and enabled.
a. If additional VUI commands other than the default commands are available for use, verify that all VUI commands are accurate in all supported languages.
6. Repeat Step [3] with Xbox SmartGlass, if SmartGlass navigation through iNavigationController events are supported by the title."
custom_expected: Navigation commands must function as expected.

title: XR-003 Title Quality for Submission 003-6 Speech-Control Functionality
custom_preconds: Ensure that the Kinect audio calibration is run from the Settings menu before testing VUI
custom_steps:
"1. Sign in to an Xbox profile.
2. Launch the title.
3. Where supported, verify that the title allows access to all VUI functions and commands using the Kinect sensor.
4. Ensure that all accents and dialects are tested throughout gameplay and menus.
5. Repeat Steps [2] – [4] for all supported modes.
6. Repeat Steps [2] – [4] in all supported languages."
custom_expected: If the title supports voice commands via the Kinect sensor array or secondary voice peripherals, all controls and commands must function without issue.

title: XR-003 Title Quality for Submission 003-8
XR-003 Title Quality for Submission 003-11 User Laterality
custom_steps:
"1. Sign in to an Xbox profile.
2. Launch the title.
3. Select a game mode that supports the use of Kinect.
4. Verify that all skill-based, precision actions can be performed with either the right or left foot (or hand, as applicable) unless the title clearly directs that use of the left or right part of the body is required as part of a specific gaming scenario.
5. Repeat Steps [2] – [3] for all remaining game modes that support the use of Kinect."
custom_expected: Users must be able to use the hand of their choice for hand gestures (and the foot of their choice for foot gestures) when performing game-specific actions.

title: XR-003 Title Quality for Submission 003-12 Unexpected Grammar and Gestures
custom_steps:
"1. Sign in to an Xbox profile.
2. Launch the title.
3. Navigate to an area of the title that supports the use of gestures or voice recognition.
4. When performing gestures not expected by the title, verify that the title does not exhibit any negative behavior as a result of the gestures or voice commands. This step should include performing actions and speaking grammar that is not expected and will not contribute to gameplay progression. For example, where asked to throw a ball, perform a kicking action instead.
5. Repeat Steps [1] – [4] for all remaining game modes.
6. Repeat Steps [1] – [5] but have another user speak supported instructions from outside of the Kinect sensor field of view.
7. Ensure that the title correctly handles instructions spoken by another user not involved in the game. If the title does not allow progression due to interference, ensure that the correct messaging is displayed and the user is given troubleshooting help."
custom_expected: Titles must not show any negative effects as a result of users performing gestures or giving voice commands when they are not expected

title: XR-003 Title Quality for Submission 003-13 Sensor Position
custom_preconds: Through the system Kinect calibration, ensure that the Kinect sensor sees and recognizes the floor before testing begins.
custom_steps:
"1. Position the Kinect sensor at the highest recommended height (180 cm).
2. Sign in to an Xbox profile.
3. Launch the title.
4. Over the course of testing, ensure that all aspects of the title can be navigated correctly from all areas of the play space.
a. Testing must occur toward the front, rear, and sides of the Kinect sensor’s field of view.
5. Exit from the title and power down the console.
6. Position the Kinect sensor at the lowest recommended height (60 cm).
7. Launch the title.
8. Ensure that all aspects of the title can be navigated correctly from all areas of the play space.
a. Testing must occur toward the front, rear, and sides of the Kinect sensor’s field of view."
custom_expected: With the Kinect sensor placed at all supported sensor heights, all aspects of the title’s user interface (UI) must be fully accessible to users when reasonably positioned within the sensor’s field of view.

title: XR-003 Title Quality for Submission 003-20
XR-003 Title Quality for Submission 003-21
XR-005 Virtual Keyboard Support 005-1
XR-005 Virtual Keyboard Support 005-2
XR-013 Linking Microsoft Accounts with Publisher Accounts 013-01
XR-014 Personal Information 014-01
XR-015 Privacy and Permissions 015-013
XR-021 Help and Support Information 021-01
XR-021 Help and Support Information 021-02
XR-022 Official Naming Standards 022-01
XR-027 Speech Language Support 027-02
XR-028 Global Speech Commands 028-01
XR-112 Establishing an Initial User and Controller 112-02
XR-112 Establishing an Initial User and Controller 112-03
XR-113 Active User Management 113-01
XR-113 Active User Management 113-02
XR 113 Active User Management 113-03
XR-114 Driving Usage Based on the Active User and Controller 114-01
XR-115 Addition and Removal of Users or Controllers 115-01
XR-115 Addition and Removal of Users or Controllers 115-02
XR-115 Addition and Removal of Users or Controllers 115-03
XR-116 Handling Users and Controllers When Resuming from Suspended and Constrained Modes 116-01
XR-116 Handling Users and Controllers When Resuming from Suspended and Constrained Modes 116-02
XR-116 Handling Users and Controllers When Resuming from Suspended and Constrained Modes 116-03
XR-046 Display Name and Gamerpic 046-01
XR-048 Profile Settings Usage 048-01
XR-050 Tile-Save Dependencies 050-01
XR-052 User State 052-01
custom_steps:
"1. Ensure that Profile A and Profile B have set the console to Home.
2. Ensure that Profile A has save data including game progress and user preferences.
3. Ensure that Profile B does not have any save data.
4. Sign into Profile A and launch the title.
  a. Ensure all save data and preferences have been preserved by visiting all areas of the title, including but not limited to:
  b. Single-player or multiplayer game sessions.
  c. Menus.
  d. Video or audio playback.
5. Sign out of Profile A and sign into Profile B. 
6. Verify that the title correctly updates the user progress, saved state, preferences, achievements, or other awards of Profile B by revisiting all areas of the title validated in step 4.
7. Begin gameplay to create save progress, and alter user preferences for Profile B.
8. Terminate and re-launch the title and verify that the save data from step [7] is reflected accurately.
9. Sign out of Profile B.
10. Delete save data ‘Everywhere’ from Profile A and repeat steps [4]-[8]."
custom_expected:
Changes to the primary user should be treated appropriately by the title.

Pass examples:
1. User progress, saved state, preferences, achievements, or other awards are associated with the correct user following a user change.

title: XR-052 User State -User Change During Suspended or Terminated State
custom_steps:
"1. Sign in to a profile and launch the title.
3. Visit all areas of the title, including but not limited to:
  a. Single-player or multiplayer game sessions.
  b. Menus.
  c. Video or audio playback.
4. Suspend the title by running ‘xbapp suspend /n [PFN]’.
5. Wait one second for the title to fully suspend.
6. Sign out the primary user and sign in as a different user.
7. Launch the title using the new user and attempt to continue from the previous user’s location.
8. Repeat Steps [1] – [6] for all areas of the title.
9. Repeat Steps [1] – [7] but terminating the title rather than suspending it."
custom_expected:
Changes to the primary user should be treated appropriately by the title.

pass example:
"1. The title state upon launching with a different user is contextually appropriate for the type of title.
2. User progress, saved state, preferences, achievements, or other awards are associated with the correct user following a user change."

fail example:
"1. The title incorrectly associates user progress, saved state, preferences, achievements, or other awards with a user following a user change.
2. The title continues to award save data to the first user without seeking confirmation."

title: XR-052 User State 052-04
XR-074 Loss of Connectivity to Xbox Services 074-01
XR-074 Loss of Connectivity to Xbox Services 074-02
XR-074 Loss of Connectivity to Xbox Services 074-03
XR-074 Loss of Connectivity to Xbox Services 074-04
XR-076 Graceful Connectivity Loss to Partner-Hosted Services 076-01
